title: Beta regression
summary: Beta regression is a form of regression which is used when the response variable, y {\displaystyle y} , takes values within ( 0 , 1 ) {\displaystyle (0,1)} and can be assumed to follow a beta distribution.[1] It is generalisable to variables which takes values in the arbitrary open interval ( a , b ) {\displaystyle (a,b)} through transformations.[1] Beta regression was developed in the early 21st century by two sets of statisticians: Kieschnick and McCullough in 2003 and Ferrari and Cribari-Neto in 2004.[2]
